input_text: LU Factuality: The late Bin Baz was the grand Muslim scholar in Saudi Arabia.
LU Factuality: Al-Maqdasi, a Jordanian militant, is sympathetic to Al-Qaida.
LU Factuality: He was acquitted in Jordan of charges that he had ties to Al-Qaida.
LU Factuality: In a recent interview with Al-Jazeera he spoke against the Arab regimes.
LU Factuality: Immediately after the interview, he was apprehended again by the Jordanian authority.
LU Factuality: Sheik Rida, fear God.
LU Factuality: You are not fair when you belittle Sheik Bin Baz's blunder and exaggerate the one by Sheik Maqdasi...
LU Factuality: Sheik Maqdasi did not criticize Sheik Bin Baz's only for his edict which emphasizes not to consider a regime an apostate if it hasn't adhered to Islamic laws.
LU Factuality: Well, this is not the case.
LU Factuality: If, you study the evidences and statements released by these people, we tend to appreciate their ignorance which was based on prominent views.
target_text: (study, true); (evidences, true); (statements, true); (tend, true); (appreciate, false); (based, true); (views, true)

input_text: LU Factuality: We had done that before with others who were known for their serious blunders.
LU Factuality: I'm not going to illustrate these evidences and statements; God is my witness, I don't want to deceive anyone.
LU Factuality: However, I will mention one of these evidences reiterated by them.
LU Factuality: Indeed, the Sheik issued two edicts regarding the same issue that contradict each other...
LU Factuality: First, he forbade seeking the aid of infidels when the Syrian Mujahiddin asked Saddam Hussein to overthrow the regime of Hafiz Al-Assad in Syria.
LU Factuality: However, he allowed the Gulf regimes to depend on the infidels in attacking Saddam Hussein.
LU Factuality: [He issued] more edicts to accommodate the policies of the Saudi regime.
LU Factuality: This behavior and not the edict itself forced them to be deceptive.
LU Factuality: I am sure that you are aware of all these suspicions that surround the regime's [Religious] scholars.
LU Factuality: So, try to appreciate the Muslims' position, especially if these suspicions are credible.
LU Factuality: Brother Rida, I plead to you through this article to understand the views of others, just like we try to understand the views of those who went astray.
target_text: (plead, true); (understand, true); (views, true); (try, true); (understand, unknown); (views, true); (went, true)

input_text: LU Factuality: My dear sister, I hope all is well.
LU Factuality: How is Turkey?
LU Factuality: I hope you are enjoying your stay there.
LU Factuality: I wrote a letter to Ayman.
LU Factuality: Please print it on a thin paper; may God reward you.
LU Factuality: Please read this message if you have the time.
LU Factuality: I am open for any suggestions.
LU Factuality: I hope I can communicate with you through the Messenger before you depart Turkey.
LU Factuality: Send my regards to my aunt, uncle and grandmother.
LU Factuality: Take back the stuff which Ayman asked you to carry to Saudi Arabia.
LU Factuality: I apologize for any inconvenience.
LU Factuality: Peace be upon you.

U.S. Congressman Concludes Landmark Visit to Iraq BAGHDAD, April 20 (Xinhua) â€“
LU Factuality: U.S. Democratic Party Congressman Tony Hall left here Thursday after concluding his landmark visit to Iraq, which has been under sweeping U.N. sanctions since 1990.
LU Factuality: In a statement, Hall expressed regret over the negative impacts of the decade-old sanctions on Iraqi people.
LU Factuality: During his four-day stay, Hall visited hospitals and health institutions in Baghdad and the southern Muthana Province.

LU Factuality: The U.S. lawmaker got acquainted with the sufferings of the Iraqi children because of acute shortage of food and medicine as a direct result of the embargo, reported the Iraqi News Agency (INA).
target_text: (acquainted, false); (sufferings, false); (shortage, false); (result, false); (embargo, false); (reported, true)

input_text: LU Factuality: He also witnessed cases of malnutrition and poliomyelitis that have doubled since 1990, when U.N. imposed the sanctions against Iraq for its invasion of Kuwait, said the INA.
target_text: (witnessed, false); (malnutrition, false); (poliomyelitis, false); (doubled, false); (imposed, true); (sanctions, true); (invasion, true); (said, true)

input_text: LU Factuality: Hall said on Monday that he regretted the miserable humanitarian situation in Iraq while visiting a hospital in the Mansour district of the Iraqi capital.

LU Factuality: Iraq has claimed that over 1.2 million people, mostly children and the elderly, have died during the last 10 years, and blames the deaths on shortages of food, medicine and other essential supplies.

LU Factuality: Iraq has been accusing the U.S. and Britain of deliberately impeding the implementation of the U.N. oil-for-food deal which allows Baghdad to sell oil under U.N. supervision, thus worsening the humanitarian crisis in Iraq.
target_text: (accusing, true); (impeding, false); (implementation, false); (deal, false); (allows, true); (sell, true); (worsening, false); (crisis, false)

input_text: LU Factuality: Hall's landmark visit to Iraq started on Sunday evening when he arrived here by land from Amman, Jordan.
LU Factuality: Upon arrival, Hall said that his visit, the first of its kind by an American congressman since the 1991 Gulf War, was not political but humanitarian.
LU Factuality: "There are a lot of issues I want to look at, but the issue of humanitarian concerns is number one," he said.

Inauguration of free zone in Dubai for e-commerce
LU Factuality: Dubai 10-28 (FP) - Dubai's Crown Prince Sheikh Mohamed Bin Rashid Al Maktoum inaugurated a free zone for e-commerce today, called Dubai Internet City.
LU Factuality: The preliminary stages of the project, the only one of its kind according to its designers, are estimated at $200 million.
LU Factuality: Sheikh Mohamed, who is also the Defense Minister of the United Arab Emirates, announced at the inauguration ceremony that "we want to make Dubai a new trading center."
target_text: (is, true); (Minister, true); (announced, true); (ceremony, true); (want, false); (make, unknown)

input_text: LU Factuality: The minister, who has his own website, also said: "I want Dubai to be the best place in the world for state-of-the-art technology companies."
LU Factuality: He said companies engaged in e-commerce would be able to set up offices, employ staff and own equipment in the open zone, including fully-owned foreign companies.
target_text: (said, true); (engaged, false); (would, false); (be, unknown); (set, false); (employ, false); (own, false); (including, false)

input_text: LU Factuality: The e-commerce free zone is situated in north Dubai, near the industrial free zone in Jebel Ali, the top regional and tenth international leading area in container transit.
LU Factuality: The inauguration of Dubai Internet City coincides with the opening of an annual IT show in Dubai, the Gulf Information Technology Exhibition (Gitex), the biggest in the Middle East.
